content:
Hi all, I'm in tactic mode and hoping to rewrite the set difference in following goal:

⊢ a ∈ A \ C

However, I have not been able to find the identifier associated with the set difference definition.
To be clear, if I wanted to do something similar for union:

⊢ a ∈ (B ∪ C)

then, to unfold the union, I could use rw [union_def].

Could someone please clue me in to what I should use to rewrite set difference that would expand the goal out to an expression involving logical operations?
docs#Set.diff_eq ? the operator is sdiff, and for Sets the function is Set.diff
Awesome, rw [Set.mem_diff] did the trick, thank you Matt!
Derek Rhodes has marked this topic as resolved.
For clarity, it is quite terrible that the operator has a different name just for Set
Like union, intersection, subset...? I thought we'd established that this was just what people wanted
Well, ∪ is (currently) a different operator to ⊔, so that's not really the same problem. And \ is called sdiff on Finset.
